items.title: The Nintendo GameCube is about to get its due
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced that classic GameCube games will be available on the Nintendo Switch Online (NSO) service, now termed "Nintendo Classics."
- Launch titles for the Nintendo Switch 2 will include “The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker” and “F-Zero GX”.
- Preorders for the Switch 2 will prioritize long-time NSO subscribers.
- Other GameCube re-releases mentioned include “Super Mario Strikers” and “Chibi-Robo!”
- A wireless recreation of the GameCube controller will be available for gameplay.
- Despite its lower sales compared to the Wii and Switch, the GameCube is receiving renewed attention through these re-releases and NSO additions.

items.title: How the Nintendo Switch 2 compares to prior models on paper
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The Nintendo Switch 2 is priced at $449.99 and will release on June 5th, 2025.
- Features a 7.9-inch 1080p LCD display, larger than previous models.
- Comes with 256GB internal storage and can expand via microSD Express cards (up to 2TB).
- New GameChat feature for voice calls, screen sharing, and video chatting.
- Improved CPU and GPU performance with 4K gameplay at up to 60fps when docked.
- Battery life varies: 2.5 to 6.5 hours for Switch 2, while previous models last 4.5 to 9 hours.
- New Joy-Con design with magnetic connection and enhanced durability.
- Launch titles include games like *Mario Kart World* and *The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom*, as well as backward compatibility with most original Switch games.

items.title: NaNoWriMo Organization Announces Closure After 20 Years
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- NaNoWriMo is shutting down after more than 20 years due to financial struggles.
- The organization began in 1999 with 21 writers and became a nonprofit in 2006.
- Over 400,000 writers participated in 2022's programs.
- In 2023, many writers left due to the organization's stance on AI in writing and issues regarding a moderator.
- Participation and fundraising have declined in recent years; the site will remain online but stop hosting challenges.
- The email to the community expressed that the closure represents a significant loss for writers, with hope for future opportunities.

items.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Introduces GameChat and Enhanced Online Features
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Nintendo launched its Switch 2 Direct with the exclusive title **Mario Kart World**.
- The Direct showcased **GameChat**, a voice and video chat system for gaming friends.
- GameChat allows screen sharing; however, experienced lower framerates and sound quality issues were noted.
- An **Open-Access Period** for GameChat is available until **March 31, 2026**, without requiring Nintendo Switch Online.
- New feature **GameShare** allows multiplayer play with shared games.
- The Nintendo Switch Online app is rebranded to the **Nintendo Switch App** and offers new features including 100 recent captures and a section for **Zelda Notes**.
- The **Expansion Pack** of Nintendo Switch Online will include GameCube titles and upgraded editions of select games at no extra charge.

items.title: Donald Trump announces tariffs that could raise the price of almost everything you buy
The best ereader to buy right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- E-readers provide a book-like experience with fewer distractions and less eye strain.
- Features to look for include easy navigation, waterproofing, note-taking capabilities, and access to a wide selection of digital titles.
- The 12th-gen Kindle Paperwhite is recommended for Amazon users, priced at $159.99, with features like a 7-inch 300ppi screen and IPX8 waterproofing.
- The Kobo Libra Colour is a strong alternative for non-Amazon users, priced at $229.99, offering a color screen and physical buttons but lacks the ease of accessing Amazon's library.
- Kindle models have a proprietary format, limiting compatibility with non-Amazon ebooks, while Kobo supports EPUB files for a wider selection.
- The base-model Kindle at $109.99 is noted as the best cheap option with excellent display resolution and USB-C charging.

items.title: Thunderbird email is going pro to better compete with Gmail
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Thunderbird is launching paid "pro" tier services to compete with Gmail and others.
- New offerings include @thundermail.com email addresses, appointment scheduling, file sharing, and AI features.
- Users can join a beta waitlist at [thundermail.com](http://thundermail.com/).
- Announcement made by Thunderbird managing director Ryan Sipes on a planning discussion group.
- Original Thunderbird client launched in 2003; development handed off in 2012 and moved to MZLA Technology Corporation in 2020.
- Sipes stated: "It is better late than never" regarding the new services.

items.title: Apple stumbles with latest AirPods Max firmware
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Apple announced that lossless audio and ultra low latency features were coming to AirPods Max with USB-C.
- Firmware version 7E99 was supposed to be released with iOS 18.4 and macOS Sequoia 15.4 but has been delayed.
- Apple added a 'coming soon' note for the AirPods Max firmware on their support site.
- The delay might be due to an error in the update file, requiring additional updates to iOS and macOS.
- Apple introduced a USB-C to 3.5mm cable for AirPods Max that works without the firmware update.
- The update process for AirPods is criticized as being too complex and lacking a manual trigger option.

items.title: Here are the best AirPods deals you can get right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Discounts on Apple’s AirPods lineup are available, including AirPods Max, AirPods 4, and AirPods Pro.
- The new AirPods 4 models offer improved sound, additional comfort, and a price range of $129 for the standard and $179 for the noise-canceling version, both available with discounts.
- The latest AirPods Pro have enhanced noise cancellation and start at $199, with current offers at Amazon and Walmart.
- Deals for AirPods Max available at $529 and $494.99 for the first-gen model at Best Buy.

items.title: Automattic Lays Off 16% of Workforce to Secure Future
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Automattic, the parent company of WordPress.com, is laying off about 16% of its workers, affecting approximately 280 employees.
- The layoffs were announced in a memo from CEO Matt Mullenweg, aimed at protecting the company’s long-term future.
- Before the layoffs, Automattic had 1,777 employees, which has now been reduced to 1,495.
- Mullenweg previously offered employees $30,000 or six months of salary to voluntarily leave if they disagreed with the company’s direction regarding a dispute with WP Engine.
- The company has faced legal challenges from WP Engine after blocking them from WordPress.org's server and taking over their Advanced Custom Fields plugin.

items.title: The Nintendo Switch smartphone app is getting some excellent new features
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced an update for the Nintendo Switch smartphone app during a Direct presentation.
- The app will allow easier transfer of screenshots and videos to phones or computers, especially for Switch 2 owners.
- Users will access the 100 most recent media directly through the app, without needing a Nintendo Switch Online membership.
- A new feature called 'Zelda Notes' will be integrated into the app, providing spoken directions and other support for 'Breath of the Wild' and 'Tears for the Kingdom'.
- The update aims to enhance the app's utility and engagement with Nintendo games.

items.title: ‘TikTok America,’ Amazon, and other rumors about who might buy TikTok
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- President Trump pushed back a deadline for banning TikTok, set to expire on April 5th.  
- Trump plans to announce a 'TikTok America' proposal, involving 50% ownership by US investors and a 19.9% share for ByteDance.  
- Amazon and AppLovin are among the potential buyers for TikTok, aiming to capitalize on its influence and ad-targeting capabilities.  
- Uncertainty remains whether any deal can satisfy US law regarding foreign ownership of TikTok.  
- Ongoing discussions regarding tariffs and additional measures are expected from the Trump administration.

items.title: Some Nintendo Switch 2 games will be more expensive
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: - Nintendo announced that Switch 2 games will have higher prices than the original Switch games. - The launch title Mario Kart World will be priced at $79.99, while Donkey Kong Bananza will cost $69.99. - This follows The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom, which launched at $69.99, marking a trend towards higher game prices for Nintendo.

items.title: Sonos permanently drops the price of its Era 100 speaker and Ray soundbar
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Sonos has permanently lowered the prices of its Era 100 smart speaker and Ray soundbar to $199 each.
- The Era 100 sees a $50 reduction from its original price of $249, while the Ray soundbar drops $80 from its $279 launch price.
- The Era 100 includes features such as stereo sound, Bluetooth audio support, and intuitive controls.
- The Ray soundbar lacks HDMI connectivity and Dolby Atmos support but is a better alternative to built-in TV speakers.
- Sonos is focused on improving its mobile app reliability and has canceled plans for a streaming video player to prioritize other products.

items.title: Verge staffers react to the Nintendo Switch 2
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The Nintendo Switch 2 will launch on June 5th.
- Design faces criticism; it lacks vibrant colors compared to the original Switch.
- It features a new 1080p 7.9-inch screen, but not OLED.
- Joy-Con controllers have been redesigned for comfort and include magnetic attachment.
- Social features, such as voice chat, are not well-received.
- The new GameCube controller has a design flaw with the ZL button.
- The price of $449.99 is higher than expected, with pre-orders starting April 9th.
- Donkey Kong Bananza, a new game, is highlighted as a significant title.
- Nintendo is charging for the Welcome Tour app, similar to tutorials of past consuls.
- No announcements for a new Super Smash Bros. game were made during the Direct.
- GameCube titles announced for Nintendo Switch Online, enhancing retro gaming access.
- New virtual game cards announced to streamline game management.

items.title: FTC Chair Will Obey Lawful Orders from Trump Regarding Meta Antitrust Case
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- FTC Chair Andrew Ferguson stated he would ‘obey lawful orders’ from President Trump regarding the antitrust case against Meta.
- Ferguson spoke at a tech policy event and described the scenario as hypothetical, emphasizing the importance of enforcing laws.
- The FTC is preparing for a significant antitrust trial against Meta aimed at potentially breaking up the company.
- Trump has made moves challenging the independence of regulatory agencies, including the FTC.
- Ferguson supports Trump’s authority over independent agencies, claiming they should be accountable to elected officials.
- Following Ferguson's statements, Mark Zuckerberg was seen entering the White House, raising further questions about potential interference.

items.title: Everything You Need to Know About the Switch 2’s Joy-Cons
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced the Switch 2 at its April 2nd Direct event, priced at $449.99 and set for release on June 5th.
- The new Joy-Cons are longer, black, and have new color accents, featuring an additional 'C' button for GameChat functionality.
- Joy-Con 2s connect magnetically, have improved analog sticks, and include features for mouse-like control in select games.
- The controllers will last about 20 hours on a charge and come with various accessories like charging grips and wheel attachments for games like Mario Kart World.

items.title: Here’s the Switch 2’s homescreen
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Nintendo showcased the Switch 2’s homescreen during a Direct presentation.
- The homescreen retains a similar layout to the original Switch, with minor aesthetic changes.
- Users may have the option of a darker UI mode, but customization features remain unconfirmed.
- Additional details about the console's specs, preorder information, and June release date were provided.

items.title: Google’s NotebookLM leader is taking over as head of the Gemini app
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Sissie Hsaio steps down as head of the Gemini app; Josh Woodward to replace her.
- Hsaio has been with Google for nearly 20 years and was pivotal in launching the company's AI chatbot Bard.
- Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis emphasizes focused evolution for the Gemini app.
- Woodward will continue as head of Google Labs while leading the new chapter for Gemini.

items.title: Every Nintendo Switch 2 game announced in the Switch 2 Direct
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced numerous games for the upcoming Nintendo Switch 2 during a Direct presentation.
- Key launch titles on June 5 include **Mario Kart World**, enhanced versions of **Breath of the Wild** and **Tears of the Kingdom**, and new chapters in **Deltarune**.
- Later releases include **Donkey Kong**, **Metroid Prime 4: Beyond**, and **Hollow Knight: Silksong**, with backward compatibility for many Switch 1 games.
- A complete list of the upcoming titles is provided, sorted by release date.
- Exclusive titles are highlighted in bold.

items.title: Best printer 2025: just buy a Brother laser printer, the winner is clear, middle finger in the air
items.author: Nilay Patel
items.summary:
- Nilay Patel recommends buying any Brother laser printer for its reliability and low cost of ownership.
- Brother laser printers are easy to use, requiring minimal maintenance and no expensive ink subscriptions.
- The article discusses the inadequacies of inkjet printers, particularly their high costs and frequent issues.
- Key advantages of Brother laser printers include long-lasting toner cartridges and simplicity in printing black-and-white documents.

items.title: Nintendo says the eShop will run more smoothly on the Switch 2
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Nintendo's Switch 2 will feature a faster-performing eShop, addressing issues from the original Switch.
- Improvements in eShop speed are due to the new system's performance capabilities.
- A new 'Game Finds for You' feature will help users quickly view screenshots and videos of games.
- The eShop aims to enhance the digital gaming experience with better navigation and a local sharing feature for digital games.

items.title: How to Preorder the Nintendo Switch 2
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Nintendo Switch 2 announced for release on June 5th at $449.99.
- Preorders start on April 9th, with bundles available for $499.99.
- Features: 7.9-inch LCD, 1080p resolution, HDR, 256GB storage, 6.5 hours battery life, and improved Joy-Cons with mouse-like functionality.
- Launch games include Mario Kart World, Split Fiction, and Cyberpunk 2077, and backward compatibility with previous Switch titles.
- Preorder eligibility requires Nintendo Account, age 18+, and previous purchase history.

items.title: Sony Announces New Bravia 8 II as Successor to 'King of TV'
items.author: Sam Byford
items.summary:
- Sony replaces flagship QD-OLED TV, the A95L, with the Bravia 8 II.
- The Bravia 8 II boasts 125% peak brightness over the A95L and 150% over last year's Bravia 8.
- Designed to deliver an authentic cinema experience, closely replicating professional monitor standards.
- To be demonstrated against major competitors: A95L, Samsung’s S95D, and LG’s G4.
- Bravia 5 TV with Mini LED backlighting is introduced as a midrange option.
- The entry-level Bravia 2 II is also launched, featuring standard LED technology.
- New Bravia Projector 7 supporting 4K 120Hz and 2,200 nits is announced, replacing an older model.
- Pricing details for all new products will be revealed in spring.

items.title: Nintendo's Switch 2 preorder process has strict requirements to thwart scalpers
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Preorders for the Switch 2 require at least 50 hours of gameplay on the original Switch as of April 2, 2025.
- The anti-scalper mechanism prioritizes players who meet gameplay requirements and have purchased a 12-month Nintendo Switch Online membership.
- Preorder invites begin on May 8, 2025, with open preorders starting on April 9 in North America and April 8 in Europe.
- The Switch 2 is priced at $449.99 and features a 7.9-inch 1080p display, 256GB storage, new game titles, and additional hardware updates.

items.title: Nintendo goes in-depth on Switch 2 backward compatibility
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Nintendo's Switch 2 will support many original Switch titles at launch on June 5th.
- A detailed resource page outlines tested titles, indicating most last-gen games will run smoothly.
- Titles like Ring Fit Adventure and 1-2-Switch are supported with original Joy-Cons or workarounds.
- Currently, only the VR Labo kit is confirmed to be incompatible.
- Some games have startup issues, while others have in-game compatibility issues; improvements are ongoing.
- Nintendo plans to provide upgrades for original Switch titles through future patches, including games like Arms and Super Mario Odyssey.

items.title: FromSoftware is making a multiplayer Switch 2 exclusive called The Duskbloods
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- New game titled *The Duskbloods* to be launched exclusively on Nintendo Switch 2 in 2026.
- Teaser trailer revealed during Nintendo's Switch 2 Direct presentation; directed by Hidetaka Miyazaki.
- Features PvPvE multiplayer gameplay, differing from traditional single-player focus of FromSoftware's previous titles.
- Comparisons made to *Bloodborne* due to gothic aesthetics and potential thematic elements.
- More details expected in a Creator's Voice article with Miyazaki on April 4th, 2026.

items.title: Kirby Air Riders is a Switch 2 racing game from Masahiro Sakurai
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Masahiro Sakurai returns to lead the development of a sequel to the GameCube racing game *Kirby Air Ride*.
- *Kirby Air Ride* originally launched in 2003 as a four-player racing game featuring Kirby and unlockable characters like Meta Knight and King Dedede.
- The new game, titled *Kirby Air Riders*, is set to be released on the Switch 2 in 2025, likely after the console's launch on June 5th.

items.title: Donkey Kong Bananza is coming to the Switch 2 in July
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Nintendo is launching a new 3D game, Donkey Kong Bananza, exclusively for the Nintendo Switch 2.
- The game's release date is set for July 17th, following the Switch 2's launch on June 5th.
- Donkey Kong Bananza is a 3D platformer featuring a new style inspired by his appearance in The Super Mario Bros. Movie.
- Players will navigate an underground world, utilizing skills like climbing, bashing, and throwing to progress through the game.
- The game includes both 3D and 2D gameplay elements, with energizing visuals and expressive characters.

items.title: Mario Kart World launches exclusively with the Nintendo Switch 2
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Nintendo has announced a new game titled *Mario Kart World* for the Switch 2, launching on June 5th.
- The game will retail for $79.99 and will be included in a $499.99 launch bundle for the console.
- Features include an open-world mode called “Free Roam,” atmospheric effects based on time and weather, and races with up to 24 drivers.
- New gameplay mechanics like grinding on rails, wall jumping, and character customization were showcased.
- The reveal was part of a Nintendo Direct event that provided more details on the Switch 2 and its game lineup.

items.title: Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment hits the Switch 2 this winter
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced the new game *Age of Imprisonment* during the Switch 2 Direct.
- This installment is a prequel focusing on Princess Zelda and King Rauru's battle against Ganondorf.
- The game is set to release this winter and features gameplay with Zelda and Rauru fighting Hylian monsters.
- The *Zelda* franchise has been crucial to the Switch's success, with previous titles like *Breath of the Wild* being critically acclaimed.
- The franchise is also expanding into live-action adaptations and theme park experiences.

items.title: Netflix Expands Subtitles and Dubbing Options for TV Viewing
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Netflix now offers a full list of language options for subtitles and dubbing when watching on TV.
- This change allows users to choose from many languages instead of the previous 5-7 based on location.
- The new feature provides flexibility similar to mobile and web browsing options, which was highly anticipated for TV viewing.

items.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong is launching in 2025
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Hollow Knight: Silksong has a new release window set for 2025.
- Originally announced as DLC for Hollow Knight, it grew too large and unique for that purpose.
- The game will feature a new kingdom, moves, weapons, and enemies.
- Gameplay was previously showcased during E3 2019, with only a few updates since.
- It was delayed shortly before its expected release in 2022.

items.title: GameCube games are coming to Nintendo Switch Online
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- GameCube games will be added to Nintendo Switch Online on June 5th, coinciding with the Switch 2 launch.
- Titles include *The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker*, *Soul Calibur 2*, *F-Zero GX*, and more.
- Enhanced image quality and higher resolution are promised for the new releases.
- Additional games mentioned include *Super Mario Sunshine*, *Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance*, *Pokémon XD: Gale of Darkness*, and others.
- The GameCube library will be part of the Nintendo Switch Online: Expansion Pack subscription.

items.title: The Switch 2’s Pro Controller adds customizable rear buttons
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Nintendo unveils a new Pro Controller for the upcoming [Switch 2](https://www.theverge.com/news/630264/nintendo-switch-2-specs-details-performance).  
- Features new rear buttons ('GL' and 'GR') for customizable controls and a 'C' button for voice/video chats.  
- Includes a 3.5mm audio jack at the bottom.  
- Controller maintains a similar layout to the original but switches to a matte black body with glossy white accents.  
- No price announced, but the original Switch Pro Controller retails at $69.99. Likely to launch on June 5th alongside the Switch 2.

items.title: Nintendo is upgrading the Switch’s best Zelda games with Switch 2 Editions
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary: - Nintendo announced enhanced versions of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom for the Switch 2. - The games will feature improved resolution, frame rates, and HDR support, aiming for smooth 60fps gameplay. - A new second-screen experience called Zelda’s Notes will assist players via the Nintendo Switch app, providing locations on the map and guidance for discovering in-game features. - The Nintendo Switch Online app will be renamed to simply "Nintendo Switch" by the end of May.

items.title: The Nintendo Switch 2 has a camera accessory for video chats
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Nintendo announces the Nintendo Switch 2 Camera, allowing video chats with friends.
- The camera is designed to sit next to the TV and can be used with Nintendo's new GameChat system.
- Users can display their face via an overlay on games or as a standalone video feed.
- Some games, including upgraded Mario Party: Jamboree, will utilize the camera for minigames and to show friends' faces while playing.
- The camera launches on June 5th, coinciding with the release date of the Switch 2.

items.title: Metroid Prime 4: Beyond is getting a Nintendo Switch 2 Edition
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced a Nintendo Switch 2 Edition for *Metroid Prime 4: Beyond* with new control options and enhanced graphics modes.
- Players can use the Joy-Con’s mouse functionality and choose between quality (4K 60fps docked, 1080p 60fps handheld) and performance modes (1080p 120fps docked, 720p 120fps handheld) with HDR.
- The game is set to release in 2025, following a recent Nintendo Direct demonstration showcasing the planet Viewros and new abilities of Samus Aran.

items.title: Nintendo’s Switch 2 ‘C’ button is a Discord-like GameChat feature
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Nintendo reveals the purpose of the new ‘C’ button on the Switch 2 controller as a GameChat feature.
- GameChat allows players to communicate via the console's built-in microphone and features background noise filtering.
- The feature also supports screen sharing, enabling friends to broadcast their gameplay during group calls, regardless of the game being played.

items.title: Segway’s robot mower for massive lawns hits the US
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Segway’s Navimow X3 series now available in the US; includes models for large lawns.
- Models range from $2,299 X315 (0.4 acres) to $4,999 X390 (2.5 acres).
- Mows 1.25 acres in 24 hours; covers 0.3 acres per charge; 80 minutes to recharge.
- Equipped with add-on support for trimmer, fertilizer spreader, launching in Summer 2025.
- Uses Exact Fusion Location System for navigation; identifies over 200 obstacles.
- Operates at 60 dB; includes anti-theft GPS tracking.
- Can be managed via app or voice controls with Alexa and Google Home.
- X390 priced lower than Husqvarna’s $5,900 equivalent; competition for smaller lawns with new models coming soon.

items.title: Tesla’s sales plummet 13 percent as Musk backlash grows
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Tesla's sales fell 13% year over year in Q1 2025, producing 362,615 vehicles and delivering 336,681.
- Deliveries included 323,800 Model 3 and Model Y vehicles, marking a 12.9% decline from Q1 2024.
- The report was Tesla's worst in three years, with stock dropping nearly 36% in 2025.
- Sales in Europe down nearly 43% year over year; China saw a decline until the last week of the quarter.
- Other automakers report strong EV sales; General Motors sold nearly 32,000 EVs in Q1, doubling year over year.
- Musk's political controversies and protests against the company are impacting sales, with a movement aimed at boycotting Tesla.
- Musk plans to launch an “unsupervised” robotaxi pilot in June in Austin, Texas, amid skepticism about autonomous driving technology.

items.title: Adobe launches Premiere Pro’s generative AI video extender
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Adobe Premiere Pro version 25.2 is launched with AI-powered features for improved video editing.
- Introduces Generative Extend, allowing two seconds of clip extension and ambient audio extension.
- Generative Extend is free for a limited time; later requires Firefly credits based on video format and resolution.
- New AI-powered Search panel to recognize and search video content using descriptive text.
- Premiere Color Management tool introduced for better editing experience with log and raw files.
- Automatic translation of video captions into 27 languages with multiple track display capability during editing.
- Enhanced performance for both Apple silicon and Windows devices.
- Accompanied by After Effects 25.2 with new HDR features and improved caching for previewing longer compositions.

items.title: Everything revealed during the Nintendo Switch 2 Direct
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Nintendo to reveal more on the Switch 2 during a Direct on April 2nd at 9 AM ET.
- The console will have backward compatibility and allow digital game transfers via a new virtual game card system.
- Speculations about a new “C” button on Joy-Con controllers and mouse functionality.
- New games such as a Mario Kart title confirmed; expected cross-gen releases include Metroid Prime 4 and Pokémon Legends: Z-A.
- Direct to provide detailed insights into the console and its features.

items.title: Samsung’s Tab S10 FE tablets arrive with a $50 price hike
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Samsung launches the Tab S10 FE and Tab S10 FE Plus with a $50 price increase over predecessors.
- The Tab S10 FE has a 10.9-inch screen, while the FE Plus has a new 13.1-inch display.
- Both tablets feature LCD panels, 90Hz refresh rates, and run on Android 15.
- They are powered by the Exynos 1580 chipset, with options for up to 12GB RAM and 256GB storage.
- Available from April 10th; the Tab S10 FE starts at $499.99 and the FE Plus at $649.99, with a 5G version for an additional $100.

items.title: Micro USB is the bane of my existence
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
* The author expresses frustration with the continued use of Micro USB ports in gadgets after USB-C became mainstream.
* USB-C was introduced in 2014, yet many devices still rely on Micro USB, including recent tech products.
* The European Union has mandated that all new devices sold in the EU must support USB-C charging to reduce e-waste.
* The regulation applies to various devices but still allows for proprietary chargers, complicating the transition away from Micro USB.
* Adoption of USB-C is improving and is expected to continue, but consumers still face challenges with existing Micro USB products.

items.title: Valve fixes Steam Deck update that caused boot loops
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Valve issued a corrective update for the Steam client on Steam Decks after previous update caused boot loops.
- The problematic update was released on April 1st, following a SteamOS update on March 31st.
- Users reported issues with boot loops and missing GPU clock speed settings through Reddit and GitHub.
- Valve re-released the client update to fix these issues and also released updates to the beta channel for the same problems.

items.title: Roblox will let parents block people on their child’s friends list
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Roblox introduces new parental controls to allow parents to block users on their child's friends list.
- Parents can now block their children from accessing specific games and experiences.
- Children under 13 cannot unblock users or experiences that have been blocked by parents, but can request unblocking.
- Parents can view the 20 experiences their children have spent the most time in during the past week.
- These updates follow previous changes aimed at enhancing child safety on the platform.

items.title: Motorola’s first Edge 60 phone feels like canvas
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Motorola announces the Edge 60 Fusion, priced at £299.99 (around $390).
- The phone features a unique faux-canvas finish, available only in the teal version, with other colors in faux leather.
- It has IP68 and 69 ratings for dust and water resistance.
- The device is slim, under 8mm thick, with a 5,200mAh battery and a 6.67-inch OLED screen.
- RAM options up to 12GB and storage up to 512GB are available, using a MediaTek Dimensity chipset (7300 or 7400).
- Camera setup includes a 50MP main lens and a 13MP ultrawide, but limited to four sensors accounting for flash and flicker sensor.
- Expected to be first of the Edge 60 series, with previous models not launched in the US.

items.title: Here are the best Apple Watch deals right now
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Apple launched the Apple Watch Series 10 and Ultra 2 in September 2023.
- The Apple Watch Series 10 is on sale starting at $329, down $70 from MSRP.
- The Apple Watch Series 9 is available starting at $280, offering marginal upgrades.
- The second-gen Apple Watch SE starts at $199 and includes features from the Series 8.
- The rugged Apple Watch Ultra 2 is priced starting at $735, with improved display and battery life.
- Deals are currently available on Amazon and Walmart for various models.

items.title: Visible’s new plan puts Verizon’s to shame
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Visible has launched a new premium plan called the Visible Plus Pro for $45 per month.
- The plan offers unlimited 5G Ultrawideband (UW) data, contrasting with Verizon's Unlimited Welcome plan that costs $65 and lacks 5G UW.
- Visible’s Plus Pro plan includes unlimited hotspot usage at 15 Mbps, 4K video streaming, and service for one smartwatch, features not available with Verizon's basic plan.
- The plan is not subject to data prioritization limitations, which is beneficial compared to typical budget carriers.
- A comparison suggests that Visible Plus Pro may have a higher priority on the network than Verizon's own plans, improving performance during congestion.
